title: Quantum Science Seed Grant (QSSG) Program
funder: Q-FARM (Quantum Science and Engineering at Stanford)
description: This program supports innovative, groundbreaking research in quantum science and engineering, designed to stimulate high-risk, high-reward research with a focus on interdisciplinary collaboration.
detailed_overview: The Q-FARM initiative invites applications for the Quantum Science Seed Grant Program (QSSG) to support innovative and groundbreaking research in the field of quantum science and engineering. The program encourages collaborations that explore new ideas and approaches in quantum science, particularly focusing on quantum entanglement and its potential applications. The QSSG program is designed to stimulate high-risk, high-reward research and aims to support projects that explore novel ideas that could potentially lead to significant advancements. The program will award up to 5, 2-year seed grants, with funds supporting personnel, computing resources, visits from external collaborator(s), and equipment for a proof-of-concept demonstration. Decisions are made by a committee of faculty with expertise in the field.
eligibility: Teams can come from traditional QS disciplines (i.e., physics, applied physics, electrical engineering, materials science, chemistry), as well as biology and biomedical sciences (or medicine).
application_requirements: A brief description of the topic to be pursued (2 pages max)
geography: Stanford, CA (Implied internal funding for Stanford affiliates, based on address and funder)
